arguments.name: CLEARSASUSER
arguments.description: erases from the Sasuser registry the keys that were added by a user.

arguments.name: COMPAREREG1=
arguments.description: compares two registry files.

arguments.name: libname
arguments.description: is the name of the library in which the registry file resides.

arguments.name: registry-name-1
arguments.description: is the name of the first registry.

arguments.name: COMPAREREG2=
arguments.description: compares two registry files.

arguments.name: libname
arguments.description: is the name of the library in which the registry file resides.

arguments.name: registry-name-2
arguments.description: is the name of the second registry.

arguments.name: COMPARETO=
arguments.description: compares the contents of a registry to a file.

arguments.name: 'external-file'
arguments.description: is the path and name of an external file that contains the registry information.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: is a fileref that has been assigned to an external file.

arguments.name: DEBUGON
arguments.description: enables registry debugging.

arguments.name: DEBUGOFF
arguments.description: disables registry debugging.

arguments.name: EXPORT=
arguments.description: writes the contents of a registry to the specified file.

arguments.name: 'external-file'
arguments.description: is the name of an external file that contains the registry information.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: is a fileref that has been assigned to an external file.

arguments.name: FOLLOWLINKS
arguments.description: follows links that are found when processing the LIST command.

arguments.name: FULLSTATUS
arguments.description: provides additional information in the SAS log about the results of the IMPORT= and UNINSTALL= options.

arguments.name: IMPORT=
arguments.description: imports the specified file to a registry.

arguments.name: 'external-file'
arguments.description: is the path and name of an external file that contains the registry information.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description: is a fileref that has been assigned to an external file.

arguments.name: KEYSONLY
arguments.description: limits the LIST, LISTUSER, LISTHELP, and LISTREG options output to display keys only.

arguments.name: LEVELS=
arguments.description: limits the number of levels to display for the LIST, LISTUSER, LISTHELP, and LISTREG options.

arguments.name: LIST
arguments.description: writes the contents of the registry to the SAS log. This option is used with the STARTAT= option to list specific keys.

arguments.name: LISTHELP
arguments.description: writes the contents of the Sashelp portion of the registry to the SAS log.

arguments.name: LISTREG=
arguments.description: sends the contents of a registry to the log.

arguments.name: libname
arguments.description: is the name of the library in which the registry file resides.

arguments.name: registry-name
arguments.description: is the name of the registry.

arguments.name: LISTUSER
arguments.description: writes the contents of the Sasuser portion of the registry to the SAS log.

arguments.name: STARTAT=
arguments.description: starts exporting or writing or comparing the contents of a registry at the specified key.

arguments.name: UNINSTALL=
arguments.description: deletes from the specified registry all the keys and values that are in the specified file.

arguments.name: 'external-file'
arguments.description: is the name of an external file that contains the keys and values to delete.

arguments.name: fileref
arguments.description:
is a fileref that has been assigned to an external file. To assign a fileref, you can do the following:
• use the Explorer Window
•

arguments.name: UPCASE
arguments.description: uses uppercase for all incoming key names.

arguments.name: UPCASEALL
arguments.description: uses uppercase for all keys, names, and item values when you import a file.

arguments.name: USESASHELP
arguments.description: performs the specified operation on the Sashelp portion of the SAS registry.
